entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as the one who believed Harry was gone and thought he would not rise again. He is also mentioned as being ignored by his members when they muttered and shook their heads at the mention of Dumbledore's name.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as a possible greater power that could exist, one that could vanquish even Voldemort. He is also mentioned by name, causing the members of the circle to stir and some to mutter and shake their heads.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as being believed broken by Voldemort's followers, who thought he was gone.

relationships.description: Voldemort believes Dumbledore could be a greater power that could vanquish even him.
Voldemort is disappointed by Harry's ability to rise again.
